---
title: 'serve-flight-udxf'
description: "Serve a build with UDXF nodes via Arrow Flight"
---

Serve a built expression that contains UDXF (user-defined exchange function) nodes as an Arrow Flight service. The server loads the build, detects UDXF nodes, and exposes them for remote execution. Clients send data and receive results over the Flight protocol.

## Usage

Pass a build path and optional host, port, and cache options.

```bash
xorq serve-flight-udxf <build_path> [OPTIONS]
```

## Arguments

The build to serve.

| Argument | Description |
|----------|-------------|
| `build_path` | Build target: alias, entry ID, build ID, or path to the build directory |

## Options

Host, port, DuckDB path, and metrics.

| Option | Default | Description |
|--------|---------|-------------|
| `--host` | `localhost` | Host to bind the Flight server |
| `--port` | (random) | Port to bind |
| `--duckdb-path` | `<build_path>/xorq_serve.db` | Path to DuckDB file for serving |
| `--prometheus-port` | (disabled) | Port for Prometheus metrics (if opentelemetry packages installed) |
| `--cache-dir` | (system cache) | Directory for parquet cache files |

## Example

Serve a build on all interfaces on port 8080.

```bash
xorq serve-flight-udxf builds/f02d28198715 --host 0.0.0.0 --port 8080
```
